image.altText: a bunch of flowers on the floor

items.synopsis: A 58-year-old bus driver has been charged over the crash that killed 10 people and left more than 20 injured in the NSW Hunter region on Sunday night.

title.children: Bus driver charged over crash that killed 10 people in Hunter Valley

image.altText: a priest wearing glasses and a woman reverend look at the camera

items.synopsis: Twenty-four hours after a horror bus crash killed 10 wedding guests, there have been prayers, candles and a guernsey tribute.

title.children: Close-knit Hunter Valley community pulls together after tragic wedding bus crash

image.altText: Three police officers examine the underside of a bus that has turned on its side.

items.synopsis: Forensic and traffic police are piecing together the events of a fatal bus crash in NSW's Hunter Valley, which has claimed the lives of 10 wedding-goers.

title.children: What we know about how a bus carrying more than 30 wedding guests crashed in the NSW Hunter

image.altText: Silvio Berlusconi looks into the distance.

items.synopsis: The controversial politician and media mogul has died in hospital in Milan after suffering from leukaemia for "some time".

title.children: Former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi dies, aged 86

image.altText: Three flight attendants — a man in a dark suit, and two women wearing red and black dresses — stand in a plane smiling.

items.synopsis: The airline is scrapping its gender-based uniform guidelines — and it's not the first, with many airlines having updated their rules to allow staff to show their authentic selves.

title.children: Qantas to allow flat shoes, make-up and long hair on crew of any gender — but what does this mean for inclusivity?

image.altText: Yasir Al Rumayyan speaks to Dustin Johnson while holding the trophy at a LIV Golf event

items.synopsis: What the PGA Tour-PIF deal shows is that as heinous as some of Saudi Arabia's crimes are, the stakes involved in strategic global alignments are much higher, and the USA is willing to look beyond human rights abuses when necessary, writes Tracey Holmes.

title.children: Terrorism, big business and foreign policy — the reshaping of global golf

image.altText: Blurry screenshots of personal ID documents like passports, and other documents marked "confidential".

items.synopsis: The newest victims of a notorious Russian ransomware gang say they have been terrified by the latest cyber attack on an Australian bond broker that has billions of dollars under advice.

title.children: 'You have 3 days': Russian criminals post screenshots of passports to dark web after bond broker data breach

image.altText: Donald Trump in blue suit and red tie speaking at podium with US flag in the background.

items.synopsis: Former US attorney-general William Barr says Donald Trump is "toast" if allegations that he wilfully retained hundreds of highly classified documents are proven true under Special Counsel Jack Smith's 37-count indictment against the former president.

title.children: Donald Trump's former attorney-general says 'he's toast' if indictment allegations are true

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: Patients will no longer have to travel hundreds of kilometres or pay thousands in up front costs as a bulk-billed care centre opens in the NSW Riverina.

title.children: Cancer patient's travel time cut from four hours to two minutes

image.altText: A young man runs away from the camera on a football field at night kicking a soccer ball. He is wearing a team uniform.

items.synopsis: Australian soccer's governing body is taking a cut from every local bet placed on games at all levels, including amateur suburban competitions.

title.children: 'It's disturbing': This suburban football club had no idea international gamblers could place bets on their games

image.altText: Mayon volcano belches red-hot emissions down it's slope as seen from Legaspi, Albay province.

items.synopsis: The Philippines' most active volcano spews lava down its slopes, as thousands of villagers prepare to flee amid fears of life-threatening explosion.

title.children: Philippines volcano spews lava down slopes in gentle eruption putting thousands on alert

image.altText: a man sitting on a balcony holding a cup and looking at the camera

items.synopsis: Joseph Markov fled his home with just his walking stick as the flames destroyed the neighbouring historic building in Surry Hills. He fears he is weeks away from being able to return home.

title.children: Joseph has stayed in six hotels since the Sydney fire, he still doesn't know when he can return home

image.altText: A man speaks into a megaphone surrounded by journalists outside in PNG

items.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's former prime minister, Peter O'Neill, is charged with giving false evidence after a commission of inquiry recommends he be prosecuted.

title.children: Former PNG prime minister Peter O'Neill charged with giving false evidence at inquiry

image.altText: Australian banknotes, mostly $50 bills, strewn over a flat surface.

items.synopsis: Almost 5 million Australians claimed work from home expenses last financial year, but the ATO has changed the methods you can use to claim tax deductions this tax time. Landlords renting out property and crypto investors are also under focus.

title.children: The ATO's changed the methods you can use to claim tax deductions for working from home

image.altText: A group of soldiers and small frail children covered in blankets on the jungle floor

items.synopsis: The eldest child of the four siblings told her family their mother was alive for four days before she died from injuries in plane crash.

title.children: Rescued child says mother survived for days in jungle after plane crash

image.altText: Xavier Coates, wearing his Queensland State of Origin guernsey and a mouth guard, looks to the sky.

items.synopsis: Queensland coach Billy Slater has made three changes to the side who claimed victory in State of Origin I as the Maroons look to wrap up the series on home soil.

title.children: Injury-plagued Queensland recall three players for State of Origin II

image.altText: A young girl's hand over an elderly man's hand sitting on the arm of a chair.

items.synopsis: The Illawarra Shoalhaven Local Health District has the most patients waiting in hospital to be transferred to aged care as a growing number of homes close their doors.

title.children: Aged care closures trigger hospital 'bed crisis' as operators blame funding, staff shortages

image.altText: A bearded man in a baseball cap

items.synopsis: Richmond player Marlion Pickett is granted bail after allegedly carrying out burglaries on commercial properties in which more than $380,000 was stolen.

title.children: Details revealed of Marlion Pickett's alleged involvement in theft of $380k from commercial premises as bail granted

image.altText: Composite image of Shellie Morris, Astrid Jorgenson, Tim Winton and Barry Humphries.

items.synopsis: Prominent Australians including author Tim Winton and late comedian Barry Humphries are appointed to the Order of Australia, in the first year women outnumber men on the honours list.

title.children: 'Life's great, I love it': The passionate Australians being honoured this King's Birthday

image.altText: A woman wearing a black one-piece swim suit stands in front of a large striped umbrella on a crowded sandy beach.

items.synopsis: For the better part of a century shows in regional areas have been crowning queens. But as Australia strives to be more diverse, some say it's time that changed.

title.children: Amid the push for inclusivity, is it time for country shows to change her majesty's title?

image.altText: A drone shot of large oil tanks and processing facilities.

items.synopsis: Thevenard Island was once a lucrative oil field, but the Pilbara tourism sector hopes it can become a tourism hotspot.

title.children: Can this abandoned oil field be transformed in to a must-see holiday destination?

image.altText: A blurred image from high of a crowd of people.

items.synopsis: A lack of data on how consumers are responding to monetary policy could lead the Reserve Bank to raise rates into a recession. And what if that's difficult to escape? It's a critical economic question right now, writes David Taylor.

title.children: The economy is in a race to the bottom and nobody wants to win

image.altText: The outline of four women, kept anonymous, superimposed over shattered glass

items.synopsis: The deaths of four Aboriginal women in the Northern Territory briefly captured headlines. But years after their deaths, the coroner is about to examine each of their tragic stories in depth.

title.children: Coroner examining deaths of four Aboriginal women warns evidence will be 'shocking'

image.altText: A sign outside Banksia Hill Detention Centre with a police officer nearby.

items.synopsis: The WA Department of Justice is accused of intimidating and bullying staff who speak about Western Australia's juvenile detention facilities, including by warning them about possible jail time.

title.children: 'Cease immediately': Leaked email shows warning to Banksia Hill officers over workplace conversations

image.altText: Bluey holds a cricket ball next to her dad, Bandit.

items.synopsis: The new Bluey episode, cricket, is a perfect homage to the backyard game, and an example to never give up in pursuit of your dreams.

title.children: Bluey's ode to backyard cricket a perfect lesson on what the game is about

image.altText: Woman with dark hair and dark glasses in a red jumper. There is a lamp behind her. She is facing us but looking to the right.

items.synopsis: Kerry has seen three family members battle motor neurone disease. But she's hopeful for a cure  and experts are on her side.

title.children: Kerry lost her daughter and ex-husband to MND. Now, her son is living with the condition

image.altText: Headshots of a smiling man in a cap wearing glasses, and a woman wearing sunglasses

items.synopsis: A 23-year-old man who allegedly ran over and killed WA police officer Anthony Woods in Perth is set to be charged with his murder, as the constable's family remember him as "a devoted husband and loving son".

title.children: Police to lay upgraded murder charge over WA officer's death as 'shattered' family leads tributes

image.altText: CCTV man in red shirt in front of 4WD

items.synopsis: Jeremiah Rivers vanished in south-west Queensland in a case that's baffled detectives and left family and friends, across remote Western Australia, heartbroken.

title.children: Inquest to probe WA man's disappearance during outback pig-hunting trip

image.altText: Woman stands next to a white ute, brown boder collie dogs sits in the tray.

items.synopsis: After five fatal dog attacks in the past year, these Wheatbelt farmers are pleading with pet owners to do more to protect livestock in the region.

title.children: 'Animals are found alive that shouldn't be' after dog attacks

image.altText: A marijuna plant.

items.synopsis: Bureau of Crime Statistics and Research findings suggest the NSW Cannabis Caution Scheme has "indirect bias" built into its eligibility criteria.

title.children: Claims of police bias as study finds Aboriginal adults caught with cannabis more likely to be charged

image.altText: Black-and-white image of a man sunbaking on a beach.

items.synopsis: He was one of the most prolific Australian photographers of the 20th century, but these lesser-known Max Dupain works have escaped the public eye for decades.

title.children: He's best known for the Sunbaker, but one chapter of photographer Max Dupain's life remains largely forgotten
